page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The main employer in Guardbridge is the long established Guardbridge paper mill, where approximatly 360 people, mainly men, work full time. Originally all its workers lived locally, but now many travel from places like Dundee and St Andrews and smaller villages in the locality, most of whom travel to work by car. As there are few services in the village:one shop,one hotel and one TSB branch bank, few people find work in this area. Work on local farms at one time employed quite a few people; but now increased mechanisation means that few are so employed. Some people who live in the village travel to work in St Andrews, 5 miles away, where there is a wider variety of job opportunities. The recent opening of a riding stables may give work to some locals.
